intro: Palala nesophila, commonly known as the pink-flowered palala, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered pink flowers that bloom during the wet season. Its leaves are elliptical and have a glossy, dark green appearance. Palala nesophila is often found growing in shaded, humid environments along forest floors or in undergrowth.
